Un cambio radical a lo usual de la saga Bioshock, pero no por eso es malo.
Me gusto mucho, el andar por los carriles aéreos fue un buen toque, sin mencionar que los plásmidos regresan como vigorizadores (con muy buenos diseños de botellas)
Y para terminar, el excelente toque momentos antes del final, una intrigante y enigmática referencia a la saga

If you havent gotten this game or even tryed it out, definitely do so. I loved this game so much, best game ever 10/10
One of the most gripping stories you'll ever play through.

Sehr zu empfehlen, da man hier fürs Geld ungefähr 10-16 Std. Spielspaß bekommt. (Zweites Durchspielen im 1999-Modus nicht eingerechnet). 
In dem Spiel sind viele kleine Details versteckt die man erst durch das zweite Durchspielen erkennt. Was den Wiederspielwert enorm erhöht. Die Charaktere (Booker [Spieler], Elizabeth) sind sehr sympatisch, da beide viel miteinander reden und interagieren. Die gesamte Story ist Filmreif geschrieben mit mehreren Wendungen versehen und enthält ein Ende das sich sehen lassen kann. Achtung, Mindfuck inklusive.

Von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung wenn man bereit ist sich der Story hinzugeben.

Selten so ein gutes Spiel gespielt. Nicht nur die Steuerung, die Gefechte und die Atmosphäre stimmt, auch die Geschichte ist einzigartig und lässt einen noch lange nach dem Spiel grüblen. Für Fans von Bioshock 1 und 2 ein Muss.
Dank der hervorragenden Nichtspielercharaktere aber auch für jeden anderen :)
A W E S O M E
Huippu

Muito bom! A historia e a trilha sonora ficaram otimos.

Best PC game EVER!!!

Infinite è il terzo capitolo della saga che porta il nome di Bioshock ma questa volta il terreno di gioco non si trova più nel fondo dell' oceano bensì in aria, sospeso in alto e composto da varie piattaforme che insieme compongono la città di Columbia. Il micromondo di Bioshock Infinite è una realtà a se stante, che a differenza di altri giochi che ripropongono scenari reali ma storie  bizzare a base di mostri, terroristi, zombie e alieni, propone invece un modesto sparatutto che affronta senza peli sulla lingua tematiche sociali adulte e ancora controverse. Il motore grafico del gioco non è dei più pesanti e ho potuto con l' ausilio di una nvidia 760 e di un Intel i5 giocare a 1080p con i dettagli al massimo sempre a 60 frame al secondo. Le sparatorie sono sempre godibili e le sezioni più belle e impegnative vi vedranno sospesi attraverso dei cavi d'acciaio che percorrono la città in lungo e in largo. Ad aiutarvi ci sarà Elizabeth la coprotagonista dell' avventura che durante gli scontri vi rifornirà del necessario per combattere. L'unica piccolissima nota stonata del gioco è rappresentata dai Vigor, i cosidetti Plasmidi dei primi 2 capitoli di Bioshock, i quali sembrano essere messi durante il gioco un po a casaccio e tranne un paio di occassioni non ci sarà alcun vantaggio ad usarne uno o l'altro pur essendo disponibili in numero cospicuo. Personalmente ho comprato questo gioco con i saldi di Steam e non ho ancora preso i vari DLC, consiglio di giocarlo e di finirlo, la narrazione del gioco è davvero ben fatta, ma ovviamente proprio per questo risulta poco rigiocabile. Assente una sezione dedicata al multiplayer.
yes

Это не просто игра, а новый мир, который открывает новые возможности, который захватиываети не отпускает, поражующий своей масштабностью и реальностью ,не смотря на всю фантастичность) Конец, который шокирует, заставляет задуматься) это не игра - это новая жизнь.
http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/458/346/f5a.gif
Amazing game with an extremely well thought out storyline.

By far, the absolute best game I have played in my lifetime. This game was so great that I am legitimately concerned that I will not be capable of enjoying any other game even close to the amount that I loved this game. The AI actually has real intelligence. Elizabeth displays real emotions, and they're completely believable. She has face expressions, and they're spot on. The combat is very well balanced throughout. I never died through combat (only by falling off Columbia a few times). If you fall off Columbia, the game developers aren't terrible people. They don't cut your health in half, or remove some ammo. They simply respawn you instantly. It's wonderful! The storyline is incredible. The ending is genuinely awesome, in the truest definition of that word. It honestly inspires awe. This game is so very well done, and I'm so glad that I got it. I was very distraught by the ending, it nearly broke me mentally. It's so beautiful, all the way through. This game is emotionally involving, and you become attached! This game will quickly grow on you! I love it! Everything in this game was thought out and done for a reason. There's no "well this happened to work out" that you can tell. Everything is done quite intentionally, from the background, to the weapons, to the scarcity of resources (when there is scarcity). There are minor side missions (definitely worth doing!), hidden shops and areas, and there are no time limits. You can fight a battle, and then take as much time as you want exploring, without Elizabeth going bonkers on you ("Hey! Listen!" isn't a thing here). I have but one regret: I started playing this game just before finals. There goes all my studying. It kept me up late at night, took up my free time, and I don't regret a moment, honestly. I just wish I had started it after finals.

To Irrational Games - You guys are brilliant. You have stunned me. You have wowed me. You have amazed me. You have tormented me. You have loved me, hated me and cared for me. You guys are wonderful, and I love you all.

To Ken Levine - People don't get this smart. You're cheating reality. Keep doing that.

To gamers - Buy this game (don't torrent this one). Play it. Allow yourself to become truly involved in this game, and it will take you on an incredible journey.

This game took me on a journey like no other. I have never had this kind of reaction from any game at all. I've been excited, saddened, and "meh", but this is beyond explanation. It is a complete and total experience, for lack of a better term. It was incredible, as beautiful as the rest of the game, astounding, and (withheld for potential spoiler prevention). I love this game.


I love this game so much.




__________________________________________________
tl;dr - Best game in existence. Getting this game is doing yourself a tremendous favor. Don't start it before finals.
the game is epic the story is twisted but really good a must buy

BioShock infinite is hands down the greatest game I have ever played. the story was immersive and packed with surprises and  the characters are unique, emotional, and very realistic. By the middle of the game i really cared about the safety of Elizabeth and the downfall of Comstock. The gameplay was fantastic because of things such as the heavy hitter enemies (OHDEARGODAHANDYMANRUN), the weapon and recource catching system, plasmids' ability to ocasionally interact with the enviroment and damage baddies, the many varieties of tears that elizabeth can create, and the use of lockpicks to discover secret areas, each contaning a recording, which acted as the puzzle pieces of columbia's history. BioShock infinite had the ability to make you feel invinsible and hopeless the next just by throwing either new enemies at you or giving you a new person or thing to both fear and hate, such as Daisy Fitzroy or Elizabeth's bitchy side. The art stile of this game was beautiful in every way imaginable and made you feel like you were really back in 1912. Or whenever the game takes place. Whatevz. What I really loved was the addition of things that were social issues at the time, such as rascism and smoking, and how they put a little BioShock twist  on them. Overall, this game has everything going for it. I couldn't have asked for a better game to add to the BioShock series,


Oh, and the Pepppermill


I looooooove the peppermill
bestest game ever

Just finished it. A work of art. Actually a work of art, I am not usimg hyperbole. Easily as good as Bioshock 1, which is saying something considering it's the third in the series, and that Bioshock was incredible. If you play games for fun and to blow shit up, this is your game. If you play games to get absorbed in the story and experience another life, this is also your game. It is rare to find a game, or any kind of entertainment really, that can offer an equally powerful experience to people who are approaching it with completely different mindsets. Highly recommended

One of the best games i ever played

About Bioshock, yes, most comment you will read will be accurate. It's a beautifull game. Now let me tell you why I didnt like it as much as previous episode. (so far) Bioshock franchise is about immersive experience, customisation, Magic & Guns, difficult choices, strong characters,  and exploration. I did not find the last three.

You will have no choice to make. Straight up line. up to the ending. I find quite ironic to have only one ending, considering the context (those who finished it will understand that).

You will know and will discover little about the main character (for future DLC ?). Protagonist are not develop more than a couple of sentence at begining of chapter up to it's conclusion. Tapes hidden around the levels are barely few words giving little of the context / goal of the characters. Only Elizabeth saves it by being a really valuable addition.

The higher pace and level design of this episode leave almost no room for exploration. No way you get lost. You just walk the (nice) corridors up to the next (beautifull) gun fight area. I think it's ok for a COD to be like this, but for a Bioshock it's not. So many question are let unanswered. Why the hell this city is here ? how does it fly, Why comstock is doing this ? I'm not even talking about the ending that will leave you with thousand more questions. 

Definitly a great game you want to play, but not the greatest Bioshock. 16/20
Good graphics and awesome storyline. The ending blew my mind.....

This game was absolutlely amazing! The story was fantastic, character development perfectly paced. The gameplay was action packed and had lots of variety. The ending will always have a special place in my gamer heart. Sooo well done!
Слов нет одни буквы, без слов и вопросов, купить и играть!

This game is amazing! The graphics are gorgeous without stepping into the terrifying zone of the uncanny valley. But the story line. The story is what takes this game and makes it a breath taking piece of art. Worth every single penny no matter the cost.

Trotz einiger nerviger Eigenheiten eines der bestens Spiele seit langem.

Was mich stört:
Das Spiel spielt sich weitgehend wie auf Schienen. Man merkt von der ersten Minute an, dass es für Konsolen geschrieben wurde und das nervte mich insbesondere anfangs ganz gewaltig.
Das Spiel reagiert gerne mal nicht auf den Befehl sich an eine Sky-Line zu hängen (Ein Transportsystem im Spiel und gelegentlich wichtiger Bestandteil in Kämpfen) bzw. braucht gefühlte Ewigkeiten um den Pfeil an der Skyline endlich anzuzeigen. Das macht das Spielgefühl teilweise unflüssig. Auch das ist vermutlich der Konsolenentwicklung geschuldet, Konsolenspieler ticken meiner Erfahrung nach bei solchen Elementen nämlich anders als PC-Spieler die schnelles Spiel gewohnt sind.

Was mich aber überzeugt hat:
Die Story! Sie ist herausragend gut. Ich habe seit langem keine so gute Geschichte erlebt. Hinzu kommt, dass vieles mit merklicher Liebe zum Detail entstanden ist. Das singende Mädchen in Finkton ist nur eines dieser kleinen Details die mich beeindruckten. Entsprechend gut wird die sich während des Spiels immer weiter verändernde Atmosphäre rüber gebracht.
Das Spiel hat mich auf diese Weise gefesselt und dafür gesorgt, dass ich viel zu lange gespielt habe, obwohl ich eigentlich besser hätte ins Bett gehen sollen.
Die deutsche Lokalisierung ist im übrigen gut gelungen, was ja auch nicht überall der Fall ist.

Von mir eine deutliche Kaufempfehlung.
Great story and plot, BioShock Infinite takes the cake in this trilogy.
Необязательно любить это направление в играх..........Это надо хотя-бы раз увидеть!

Ещё один шедевр от Кена Левина, первые его части было неплохи, но вот Infinite вывела серию на новый уровень. В игре достаточно побыть минут 20, чтобы понять, что эта игра делалась с душой и с уважением к игрокам любой категории. Так же есть режим "1999" он помогает вспомнить старые игры и их настоящую ХАРДКОРНОСТЬ. 
Из качеств могу отметить атмосферу, прекрасную музыку, озвучку, голоса, и конечно же ЭЛИЗАБЕТ - и её сыграла прекрасная девушка с милой внешностью из России.
Из недостатков: есть пару, но они малейшие. Не знаю кому как но мне игра показалась в пару моментов немного затянутой.
Графика:9.5 из 10
Музыка:9.5  из 10
Озвучивание: 10 из 10
Геймплей: 10 из 10
Сюжет: 10 из 10
Итог: 10 из 10

Time after time they keep making these great looking Bioshock games that completely lose me. I just can't get behind the terrible respawn mechanic inherent to these games. Whenever I die it drives me crazy to just come right back with almost no consequences.

Infinite is wonderful. Every single person who can play it, should play it. It’s a fascinating and gruesomely fun adventure in a genuinely unique, magnificent place. But the plot really does jump the shark. It jumps a lot of sharks. It jumps BioShark Infinisharks. That’s not uncommon in cinematic first-person shooters, but I mention it now because the game’s mysteries are such a big part of its appeal.

Probably one of the best single player experiences you'll ever have. 
It's very well written, the characters are great and it's fun to play. People very familiar with American History may get an extra kick out of it. The graphics are great, and I believe this is one of the few games that has also paid a lot of attention to sound design, which feels very rich and adds a lot to the immersion.
The game itself gives you a choice on how you want to play through various upgrade paths for vigors and weapons. Giving you some degree of determining your own playstyle.

If you're sick of the endless parade of First Person Shooters all trying to be Call of Duty, who all seem to see Single Player as shitty 5 hour tutorial with incredibly sloppy, shitty, stupid writing. This is the game for you.

All the praise this game received is well earned. The overall experiece is just outstanding. It's a sum of beautifully crafted scenarios, impressive graphics, great balance between action, exploration and storytelling and most of all, a story that could easily be an Oscar nominee if Bioshock Infinite was a movie.
